page.title: 02Buildings, Roads & Railways
page.content:
Apart from the two main areas of population, i.e. village at Shortlanesend and edge of Truro City, the area is rural with smallholdings and farms, building is sparse. However there are some places that are being developed for housing. The buildings that exist are chiefly{residential, with{commercial buildings}dominating in the city.
Three main link{roads}come into the block from St.Austell, Bodmin & Newquay and Perranporth. The main{British Rail line}from Paddington to Penzance passes the S.E. corner, through cuttings and over viaducts. At{Buckshead}the train travels through a tunnel over 300 metres long. The train engines are powered by diesel oil.
